==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|そ|しん|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=そしん}} compound {{m|ltc|祖神|tr=*tzǒ *jhin}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|祖神|tr=zǔshén}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|そ|しん}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[so̞ɕĩɴ]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|そしん}}

# {{lb|ja|mythology|Shinto|sort=そしん}} the [[deification]] of an [[ancestor]]
# {{lb|ja|mythology|Shinto|sort=そしん}} [[Amaterasu]], as an ancestor of the imperial family

=====Usage notes=====
Sometimes also encountered as ''sojin'', although this reading is less common.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|おや|かみ|k2=がみ|yomi=kun}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=おやがみ|祖|tr1=oya|t1=parent; forebear, ancestor|神|tr2=kami|t2=god, spirit}}. {{rendaku2|sort=おやがみ|kami|gami}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|n|お|や|がみ}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[o̞ja̠ŋa̠mi]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おやがみ}}

# a [[god]] as an [[ancestor]], an [[ancestral]] god
